Name: Ortho
Description:
Ortho is a game where players form words from letters on cards. The Ortho deck has 52 cards, each with a letter at either end; the two letters may be the same or different, and if different the player chooses which letter is used. There are also two "Chief" cards that are wild and can stand for any letter.

Players start with seven cards each. In a turn a player draws the top of the deck or discard pile, and if possible either plays a word onto the table, or adds cards to a word on the table to make another word. In either case a word of 2 letters scores 1 point, and doubling for each additional letter (e.g. 3 letters 2 points, 4 letters 4 points, 5 letters 8 points, etc.). 32 points is the maximum allowed for any word.

The hand ends when a player uses all their cards in play, calling "Ortho!" and also earning from each player one point per card left in their hand.  (Presumably a hand also ends when the deck is gone.) A player wins by either Ortho'ing with a total of 104+ points, or ending a hand with 128+ points.

—user summary

Name: Arnold Palmer's Table Golf
Description:
A tin board with a felt green tabletop mini-golf game. Endorsed by Arnold Palmer himself, the game was released in the mid 1960s and came with a number of plastic obstacles to create 9 holes of play. The obstacle pieces were brightly colored plastic and varied in various editions of the game, but were primarily yellow, blue, and red components. The tin board had a number of small holes numbered for the various plastic components to recreate each of the 9 holes, as the 1st hole was intended to be a straight shot to the hole. The board also has small indentations for a fairway tee and a near green tee. The game utilized plunger putters to play. The putters could be used with the putterhead on either side to be used in a pushing or striking manner.

—user summary

Name: Chi é il più forte
Description:
Chi é il più forte is a simple cooperative game based on memory. Six tiles with wolf are put on the board and also 37 tokens. They are 16 couples and 9 special. At your turn you have to turn a wheel. Some actions could happen. Turn 1,2 or 3 token. Turn a wolf tile. When you turn tokens you try to find couples. If all couples are turned before the 6 tiles of wolf you win. Else the wolf eat you and you loose.

—user summary

Name: Escape Adventures: Von Schamanen und Geisterstädten
Description: Family friendly escape game in a western setting. The story driven game includes solving puzzles as well as some deductive skills and offers a scoring at the end based in the age of the group and the used hints. Included is an overarching puzzle linking games in the series.

Name: Gobble-Ins!
Description:
Gobble-Ins is a 2-4 player "treasure-eating" game set in a fantasy world filled with spoiled heroes and hungry goblins who eat all their unwanted treasure.

Players will control one of four different goblin characters who inhabit Loot's Abandon, a deep treasure dumping hole in the center of a bustling port town where all the unwanted valuables of adventurers near and far offload their old gear. These goblins have adapted their diets to be able to consume the armor, weaponry, and trinkets that are unknowingly tossed to them, and as such, gain powerful abilities from them!

Each turn, players will move their goblins across the board, attempting to reach treasure tokens that tumble down the four corners of the game board each turn following a specific colored path. The colored path that token will follow is determined by a tumble path card that is played the second a new treasure appears on the game board. Players will attempt to pick up those treasure tokens to obtain treasure cards that imbue them with special powers while they are held in their goblin's stomach. These treasures can be turned in for points to be added up at the end of the game, but hanging onto certain treasures can be helpful as you lose their abilities once they've been removed from your stomach.

More treasure cards are pulled from the deck and treasure tokens will continue to move across the board until all the tumble path cards have been discarded or made inactive. Once this happens, players will add up the value of all the treasure cards they've stashed, as well as any remaining Vomit Tokens (the goblin's currency), and whoever has the most points is the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: Kitty Cataclysm Purrsonality
Description:
A 7-card expansion to Kitty Cataclysm.

Different superpowers for everybody!

Everyone starts with a unique purrsonality card. On your turn, instead of playing a card, you can activate your special power! Each card offers unique powers, to be used twice each game.

The expansion makes the game slightly less likely to end via empty hands, and adds a little bit more to think about.

—description from the designer

Name: Word Solitaire
Description:
The deck has 49 cards with a single letter, one card which can stand for any one of J, K, Q, X or Z, and two wild cards that can stand for any letter. The initial tableau for the game is: 

     11 cards face up across the top
     6 cards each placed on 6 of the top row, alternately face down and face up
     5 remaining cards face up as the surplus


A play is to make a words starting with one of the uncovered top row cards, using cards that are face up and uncovered (from the surplus and column ends), or from the ends of existing words. As cards are exposed they are turned face up, and can be move to the surplus (up to a maximum of 7 cards there).

The object is to have a word starting with each letter of the top row, and all letters used. For the beginning game, the 11 cards with underlined letters are used for the top row. For a more difficult game, the starting row is dealt randomly; for even more difficult, only 10 cards are in the top row.

—user summary

Name: Dragonfire: Character Pack – Heroes of the Underdark
Description:
Character Expansion to Dragonfire
Contains Character Screens including new races and class combinations unique to the Underdark setting of Dungeons & Dragons.

Name: Dragonfire: Solo Adventuring
Description:
Single Player Rules for Dragonfire
This expansion provides the necessary ruleset to make the minimum player count extend to 1.

Name: Dragonfire: Adventures – Insanity in the Abyss
Description:
Adventure Expansion to Dragonfire
Insanity in the Abyss is a Dragonfire Adventure Pack containing new character shields, market cards, encounter decks, adventures, and magic items.

Name: Dragonfire: Adventures – Into the Abyss
Description:
Adventure Expansion to Dragonfire
Into the Abyss is a Dragonfire Adventure Pack containing new character shields, market cards, encounter decks, adventures, and magic items.

Name: Dragonfire: Adventures – Undermountain Madness
Description:
Adventure Expansion to Dragonfire
Undermountain Madness is a Dragonfire Adventure Pack containing new character shields, market cards, encounter decks, adventures, and magic items.

Name: Dragonfire: Campaign – Waterdeep
Description:
Campaign Expansion to Dragonfire
Waterdeep is Dragonfire Campaign Box containing new character shields, market cards, encounter decks, adventures, and magic items.

Name: Assault from the Sky: Battle for Crete 1941
Description:
Assault from the Sky - Battle for Crete 1941 portrays the fascinating German airborne operations on Crete in May 1941. The game is playable in 1 to 2 hours maximum. Assault from the Sky - Battle for Crete is a new edition in the Battle Command Series. The game is a quick-playing game with large 3/4 rounded counters, a map board, rules, and dice. Units are rated for their strength and movement, as well an endurance rating that reflects how much damage a unit can sustain in combat.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Looncurse
Description:
Looncurse is a new battlebox that pits nature’s defenders against some of the Mortal Realms most determined despoilers. Inside, you’ll find two forces of Citadel miniatures, including two models that  are only available in this set – the Loonboss on Giant Cave Squig, and a brand-new Sylvaneth Hero, the Arch-Revenant.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Malice: 2019 Memorial Pack
Description:
A Special Set of Cards. 
In memory of our great and true friend 
Mark D. Jones
His memory lives on in the games we play.

Pack contains 10 Treasure cards (Shard of Nes, Shard of N'Jo, Shard of Re, Shard of K'Dar, Shard of Mar, Book of Nes, Bonebiter of N'Jo, Scales of Re, Sash of K'Dar, and Torc of Mar.)

Also one title card with in memorium on the back.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trimau: Grand Tour
Description:
Trimau: Grand Tour is a game for 2–6 players.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

On your turn, play a card that matches the current card, or draw a card, and play that one if you can or want to.

When playing a card you can either play “Single Play”, by playing a card where the marked of the three lanes matches the current card. Then you move the marker if possible.

After a Single Play, you can if you wish “Attack”. If the next player cannot play, you may take another turn. If he can, you must draw 2 cards.

Or you can play “Double Play”, by playing a card where the two unmarked lanes match the current cards, then moving the marker and take another turn.

—description from the designer

Name: IT Startup: Corrupted data
Description:
IT Startup - Dirty Tenders introduces 32 new, unique cards. It is self-playable for 2 players, and when combined with the base increases the maximum number of players from 4 to 6. Extends the game with a new employee mode: Project Manager. It also introduces a new game mode: building your own deck.
—description from the designer (translated)

Samodzielny dodatek IT Startup - Brudne Przetargi wprowadza 32 nowe, unikalne karty. Jest samodzielnie grywalny dla 2 graczy, a po poÅ‚Ä…czeniu z podstawkÄ… zwiÄ™ksza maksymalnÄ… liczbÄ™ graczy z 4 do 6. Rozszerza grÄ™ o nowy tryb pracowników: Project Manager. Wprowadza równieÅ¼ nowy tryb gry: budowanie wÅ‚asnej talii.
—description from the designer

Name: 8-Bit Zombie Smash
Description:
8-Bit Zombie Smash is a quick solitaire 'tile-laying' card/dice game that plays in 10-15 minutes.   Your goal is to smash as many zombies as you can while creating safe houses within the neighborhood.   You have a variety of weapons to use and certain areas to use them in.  Try not to leave any zombies alone for too long because more will be created.  Each card must lay on top of a previous card by at least one section or minus points are accrued.

There are 9 optional parameter cards that can be used with the game. You randomly draw one parameter card at the start of the game, which adds specific challenges and tactics to the game play.

This is a beat your high score style of card/dice game that only uses 18 game cards, 9 parameter cards and 10 d6.

—description from the designer

Name: A Matter of Bridges: Operation Market Garden 1944
Description:
Market-Garden: Race for the Rhine is a two-player game that simulates the first ten days of Operation Market-Garden, the airborne invasion of Holland, September 17 to September 26, 1944.

Each turn represents one day of combat, and each hex is about 8 miles across.  One player commands the defending German forces and the other player commands the invading Allied forces.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle of the Gustav Line: Cassino 1944
Description:
Battle of the Gustav Line - Cassino 1944 is a two-player game that simulates the first and second Allied offensives against the Monte Cassino portion of the German Gustav Line, January 22 to February 20, 1944.

Each turn represents five days of combat, and each hex is about 1 mile across. One player commands the Allied forces and the other player commands the German forces.

—description from the publisher

Name: Road to Rome: Anzio 1944
Description:
Road to Rome - Anzio 1944 is a two-player game that simulates the opening weeks of Operation Shingle, January 22 to February 20, 1944.  Each turn represents five days of combat, and each hex is about 1 mile across. One player commands the Allied forces and the other player commands the German forces.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dominion: Captain Promo Card
Description:
This card was designed to commemorate the victors of the "Jubiläumsmeisterschaft" (Anniversary Championship), organized in 2018 in Germany and Austria to celebrate ten years of Dominion.

Text:



    
        Captain (Action-Duration - Cost 6 [coin])

    
    
         Now and at the start of your next turn: Play a non-Duration Action card from the Supply costing up to 4 [coin], leaving it there.

    


Part of the Dominion series.

Name: Dominion: Church Promo Card
Description:
This card was designed to commemorate the victors of the "Jubiläumsmeisterschaft" (Anniversary Championship), organized in 2018 in Germany and Austria to celebrate ten years of Dominion.

Text:



    
        Church (Action-Duration - Cost 3 [coin])

    
    
        +1 Action
Set aside up to 3 cards from your hand face down. At the start of your next turn, put them into your hand, then you may trash a card from your hand.

    


Part of the Dominion series.

Name: Ciné Défi
Description:
Ciné Défi is a french quiz game. It is about cinema. You have to pick a card, roll the die, and pick the question which is attributed to your figure.

—user summary

Name: BD Défi
Description:
BD Défi is a quiz game in which you will answer to question about comic strip. You pick a card, you roll a dice, then you answer the right question.

—description from the publisher

Name: Music Défi
Description:
Music Défi is a French quiz about music. You pick a card, you roll the die, and you answer the question!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dizzle: Levels 5-8
Description: Dizzle: Levels 5-8 has exactly what it contains, which is more than the Dizzle base game contained.

Name: Oh, Fox!: The Crow
Description:
Pre order promo for Oh, Fox!
The crow promo adds one additional prey animal to the game. It includes the crow animal card and the crow identity card.

The crow likes to steal and only eats food on home spaces. With his special ability, he can fly a short distance to avoid the predator.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamp Raptor Egg Nest
Description:
Fresh from the DarkStone Forge, we are excited to present the Limited Edition Swamp Raptor Egg Nest!  This set includes a 3D version of the Egg Nest for Shadows of Brimstone first appearing in the Swamps of Death Core Set as part of the Map Tile artwork for the Swamps of Jargono OtherWorld.  This set comes with one large Egg Nest model (cast in high detail resin) and a brand new mission exclusive to this set!  These stand out pieces are easy to paint and will make an excellent addition to your Shadows of Brimstone collection!  We have very limited quantities due to the cost and difficulty to cast.

—description from the publisher

Name: Last Night on Earth: Old Betsy Faithful Hound
Description:
Now you can play as fan favorite Old Betsy the dog from Last Night on Earth. The Last Night on Earth 10 Year Anniversary Edition comes with a miniature for Old Betsy to represent her on the board in place of the counter when her card is played. With this Hero Character Sheet, Old Betsy becomes a playable Hero to take on the Zombie outbreak!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Last Night on Earth Game Engine (Flying Frog Production)

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Doomsday Device and Generators
Description:
Fresh from the DarkStone Forge, we are excited to present the Limited Edition Doomsday Device and Generators Set!  This set includes 3D versions of the Doomsday Device and Generators for Shadows of Brimstone that were first introduced in the Trederra OtherWorld Expansion.  You DO NOT need a copy of the OtherWorld: Trederra Expansion to use this set.  This set comes with the Doomsday Device and 3 Generators (all cast in high detail resin) and a brand new mission exclusive to this set!  These stand out pieces are easy to paint and will make an excellent addition to your Shadows of Brimstone collection!  We have very limited quantities due to the cost and difficulty to cast.

Mission: Countdown to Destruction - The sinister soldiers of Trederra have set up a Doomsday Device in the nearby mine! If it explodes, it will destroy everything for miles, allowing their raiders to sift through the aftermath for precious Dark Stone.  The Heroes have found the location of the Trederran Doomsday Device, but it is protected by a powerful forcefield! They must search the area to find the 3 Field Generators and destroy them, overloading the Doomsday Device and shutting it down to successfully complete this Mission.

—description from publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Batman Inc. Expansion
Description:
After having a future sight and still aiming for justice to reign around the world, Bruce Wayne made official the creation of a new international organization founded by Wayne Enterprises: Batman Incorporated. This super-heroes network, chosen by the Dark Knight himself, wages a battle against crime all over the world, shares information and provides help to one another. The vigilante therefore became famous worldwide. This notoriety brought to his cause other vigilantes, like El Gaucho, the Nightrunner, the Knight, Chief Man-of-Bats accompanied by Raven Red, the Dark Ranger, Batman of Japan, Batman of Moscow and many others… 
Through this organization, Batman managed to set up a plan against the mysterious institution called Leviathan.

During a character’s creation, our teams think of them as the comics describe them. Once the profile has been set up, our teams check if it fits what we want the character to do and if their role is the one we defined for them. There are several modifications along the playtests to adjust the different characteristics, skills… Once a hero (in the case of the Batman Inc. Expansion) is validated, they are tried in missions as replacement of heroes of equivalent roles. Numerous playtests of the many possible team composition for the heroes then occur, before making the hero fit without breaking the mission up.

Each miniature from this expansion can be played as another choice of hero in missions of the corebox. Therefore, the heroes will have much more choice than they already had. For example, Dark Ranger will be another possible choice of hero in the mission « An Icy Welcome », and he can also be picked as 2nd hero in « To Sink a City »… The Knight will make a good replacement for the 1st hero in « Biological Scourge ». Chief Man-of-Bats as well as Raven Red in « A Golden Opportunity », and so on…

Each of those heroes owns one or several equipment cards related to them. 5 new bat gadgets are also included to be added and bring more choice to the already consequent amount of bat gadgets, offering new possibilities to players.

Batman of Japan
 Batman (the one from Gotham City) maintains a network of correspondents around the world who use crime fighting techniques similar to his own. In Japan, Mister Unknown—a vigilante of who trained a promising young man named Osamu—took up the mantle. But tragically, Mr. Unknown was killed before Osamu’s training was finished. After Batman and Osamu fought together, Bruce Wayne came to support Osamu as Batman of Japan. Osamu may still be young, but he is an excellent detective and a martial arts expert. Though sometimes duty calls him elsewhere, as member of Batman Inc. his primary responsibility is protecting Japan. 
Gameplay
 That martial art expert is a great fighter capable of competing with Batman himself. He excels in hacking and is able to move wherever he wants, as heights do not frighten him at all. 
 In Adventure Mode, he can show up with his teammate, Lolita Canary. This flying small version of Black Canary has got a good breath and is able to neutralize her opponents through ultrasounds. 
Versus Power
Lolita Canary: Batman of Japan uses his girlfriend’s blast to neutralize his enemies.

Batman of Moscow
 Batman Incorporated was Bruce Wayne’s attempt to extend the Club of Heroes into major cities around the world. It was his belief that Batman could become a symbol of justice that defied borders. Crime fighters from all over the globe were equipped with their own variations of the iconic Batsuit. As one might expect, these new Batmen were as varied as the nations in which they fought. Ravil, the Batman of Moscow, was no exception. To wage a war on crime in the streets of the Russian capital was no easy task; it called for a brutal fighter—one whose methods differed from his American counterpart’s. Subtlety wasn’t going to work. 
Gameplay 
He's a demolition expert, and therefore knows everything about explosives. Would it be to throw grenades of arm and disarm explosive engines, he is second to none. 
 In Adventure Mode, he accomplishes his missions with an incendiary grenade, which spreads fire while exploding. This makes him sure no one will stand against him. 
Versus power 
Demolition expert: Batman of Moscow can clear an area close to him by triggering an explosion (level 2) there that leaves one flame token. Or he can destroy a wall thanks to his explosive devices.

Chief Man-of-bats
 Dr. William Great-Eagle, aka Man-of-Bats, understands that being a hero is about more than just beating the bad guys. William is a Chief of the Dakota Sioux and a pillar of his community. He is ceaselessly dedicated to providing social and medical assistance to those in need and a long-time member of the Club of Heroes. During the Infinite Crisis, he helped heal Blüdhaven’s wounded. With his son and sidekick “Raven Red”, he joins the Club of Heroes. Wanting to take his philanthropic actions a step further, he also became a member of Batman Inc. 
Gameplay
 He is a true support character. Helping others or sacrificing himself for them not to be wounded, he can recover, slowly, because of his knowledge in traditional and native American medicine. 
 Chief Man-of-Bats owns two equipment cards. A tomahawk that can be used during melee fights, or than he can throw (but he then loses it). He also has a medicine man’s bag, with which he can go beyond his limits for a time. 
Versus power
Duo: Chief Man-of-Bats always works with his sidekick Raven Red, recruited as his lieutenant. They heal themselves (up to 2 lifepoints each) when the event tile is activated, and Raven Red performs his small attacks against opponents in his line of sight.

Dark Ranger
 As a member of Batman Inc., Dark Ranger battles crime in the ‘Land Down Under’. Originally, Australia had its own heroic duo similar to Batman and Robin known as Ranger and Scout. But when Ranger was killed, Scout (John Riley) took over lead duties and became Dark Ranger. After the death of his mentor, John Riley became violent, but Batman made sure to check the younger man’s direct and sometimes extreme methods. Dark Ranger is not only a formidable fighter but also an excellent tracker—a useful skill to have when investigating crimes. 
Gameplay
 Always willing to save the widow and the orphan, never would he hesitate to sacrifice himself for others. Good investigator, he is always gifted with explosives. All he lacks he can find in his utility belt that he never gets rid of. 
 The Dark Ranger is heavily equipped. He can carry a jet pack; therefore, he may move free like air. He also owns an electric gun that can stun his opponents. 
Versus power
Stun: Thanks to his weapon that generates electrical pulses, he can put a “stun” token on a villain’s tile. This tile will have a higher cost the next time it is played.

El Gaucho
Santiago Vargas is a man of mystery. He once worked for the covert operations agency known as Spyral, but eventually followed Batman’s example and joined the Club of Heroes, an international group of vigilantes. 
 Though Santiago is without superpowers, he arms himself with knives, bolas and a grim determination. He occasionally teams up with others, but his operations are usually confined to Argentina and other parts of South America. 
Gameplay 
El Gaucho tends to be Batman’s equal. He’s a great fighter, would it be in melee or distance fight, he performs combos when fighting, and can counterattack. His past experiences granted him investigation and munition specialist skills. He is a true hero now. 
 El Gaucho is a bolas master. He can throw them at a long distance and shackle any opponent. 
Versus power
Gaucho bolas: El Gaucho uses his favorite weapon and can inflict severe damages. If the target isn’t neutralized, they become immobilized.

Nightrunner
In the wake of a deadly riot in the Paris suburbs, a vigilante rose up to defend the weak and vulnerable. To accomplish this mission, Bilal Alsselah employed his mastery of parkour—a means of traversing urban environments with spontaneous and dynamic acrobatics. The Dark Knight took notice of his exceptional skills and recruited him for Batman Incorporated. Bilal has since expanded his area of operations and has become Nightrunner, the dedicated protector of Paris, France. 
Gameplay
 The french Batman is the master of parkour. No heights can frighten him, no jump, nothing. He is unstoppable, too agile for anyone to catch him, and also difficult to target from a distance. 
 The Nightrunner has a taser that grants him a higher power in hand-to-hand fights. 
Versus power 
Parkour master: The event tile doesn’t cost any Activation Potential Disk to activate and the Nightrunner performs a movement.

Raven Red
 Charles Great Eagle, aka Raven Red, son of Chief Great Eagle, leader of the Dakota Sioux. Charles is a member of both the Club of Heroes and Batman Inc. Being a young man, he is more impulsive than his father and longs to enter the big league by taking on the serious super-villains rather than assisting his community. He and his father were the targets of the evil organization known as Leviathan. They also helped fight the Black Glove. Regardless of these lofty ambitions, when it comes to trouble on the reservation, Charles passionately solves challenges with his two greatest weapons: his fists. Put a bow in his hands and he is an expert shot to boot. 
Gameplay
 Raven Red is out of anyone’s league when using his bow. But as impetuous as he is, he doesn’t hesitate to use his fists when the situation calls for it. 
 He never goes without his bow and is quick to retaliate when taken by surprise. 
Versus power 
Duo: Raven Red is never far from his father, so Chief Man-of-Bats is recruited as lieutenant. When the event tile is activated, the Leader and his lieutenant regenerate (up to 1 lifepoint each), then Raven Red shoots the sharpest arrow he owns.

The Knight
Knight and Squire were English crime fighters similar to Batman and Robin. But unlike the Dynamic Duo, these two were inspired by the heraldry of the medieval era. Cyril Sheldrake is the modern version of Knight and a colleague of Batman. Being of a heroic dynasty, Sheldrake sometimes doubts Batman’s methods, but the two share a mutual trust. Regardless, he can always count on his trusted Squire to help him. Knight also has a tenacious set of armor for when he must endure the inevitable hard knocks that come with fighting crime.
Gameplay
 He is a living swiss army knife, adapting himself to every situation he bumps into. This athlete is capable of astonishing prowess despite his heavy armor that protects him. Just like Batman, he is a seasoned investigator.
 Equipped with this gauntlet, lockpicking becomes easy for him, as well as hacking into computers. 
Versus power 
Squire support: Have you ever seen a knight without a squire? They are never apart. The event gives the hero player a token that grants one of their character the luck skill level 2 for an action, because of the Squire coming to the rescue.

5 new bat gadgets
 The 5 bat gadgets you will find in this expansion will offer you new gameplay possibilities: 
Artificer Gel: This bat gadget is really helpful when it comes to disarming bombs or any explosives. 
Adrenaline Shot: Need to perform more actions, to go further than what you were capable of? Push your limits with this one-use adrenaline shot.
Sharp Batarang: This new batarang will always inflict damages… as long as you don’t aim too far from your target.
Electric Batarang: Another batarang, capable of neutralizing the most enduring opponents.
Strenghtened Armor: A new piece of equipment made of a new alloy, more efficient in melee fights.

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – League of Assassins Expansion
Description:
The League of Assassins is a thematic expansion for BATMAN™: GOTHAM CITY CHRONICLES that offers players a chance to play a 3-mission campaign, in which the heroes try to thwart Ra’s Al Ghul and his league’s plans to wipe out Gotham City.
 Ra’s Al Ghul is among Batman’s most dangerous and formidable foes. Backed by an international eco-terrorist organization, Ra’s has returned to carry out his Machiavellian plans. His daughter Talia, her twisted son Heretic, and the fearsome lady Shiva make their BATMAN™: GOTHAM CITY CHRONICLES debut in this exciting, action-packed expansion. 
The League of Assassins expansion includes 12 new minis, their tiles and 3 New Adventure mode missions, that can be played sequentially as a campaign.
The Assassins and Assassins with rifle can be used as substitutes in corebox Adventure Mode missions and are fully recruitable in Versus Mode missions.

Ra’s Al Ghul goal: to Cleanse Gotham City, creeps ever closer in this 3-mission mini campaign – He’s going to need all his cunning to outwit the Bat-team. 
To even up the odds – Ra’s Al Ghul plans to augment his faithful assassins, increasing their destructive capacity and giving them an edge to stand firm against Gotham City’s guardians. 
Creating these boosted troops is going to be a challenge- he’s going to have to obtain a DNA sample from his Grandson Damien, Prof Langstrom’s formula and hardest of all-- some DNA from the Batman himself. Once these elements are gathered together, the Demons Head will create his Man-Bat commandos, poor copies of The Man-Bat augmented by Bruce’s DNA.

What this villain succeeds in amassing during mission 1&2 determines the Man-Bat commandos stats in mission 3.

Ra’s Al Ghul (The Demon’s Head) 
Just how old is he? This scheming terrorist that cannot die - at least not permanently? Six centuries? Longer? His real name remains unknown, but the Egyptian name “Ra’s Al Ghul” (the Ghouls head”) has long been whispered in fear. 
 His secular experience makes him a formidable opponent: he is one of Batman’s few enemies that knows his secret identity.
Additionally when his luck runs out, Ra's can count on the strange Lazarus Pits, filled with a mysterious rejuvenating liquid, located in places loaded with mystical energy, to come back to life.
Life, moreover, is his obsession, and he is ready to erase all traces of humanity to enable nature to regain its rights and create a world in perfect environmental balance.
 Over time, Ra's has had several wives, and several children, the most formidable of which is his daughter Talia, who aspires to take over his terrorist organization, the League of Assassins. She also gave him a grandson, Damian, Bruce Waynes’ son.
Gameplay
In contrast to his corebox profile, where he supported his men, this time The Demon’s head is leading from the front, showcasing his superb munitions skills and taking full advantage of his Lazarus Pit dips induced regeneration skill.
Versus power
Indoctrination
As Head of the League, his Assassins accompany him at all times –the event tile with an Assassins tile. At the beginning of the mission replace the event card with the Assassins tile. This tile provides 2 Assassins minis instead of the normal 4.

Talia Al Ghul
Talia is the daughter of Ra’s Al Ghul and the on-and-off romantic interest of Batman. Her relationship with Bruce has always been complicated; the two belong to two very different worlds and often take conflicting moral stances. On one occasion, when Bruce lay drugged and injured, Talia conceived his child—a fact that would remain unknown to him for many years. Talia raised Damian according to her own standards and beliefs and this tale of secrecy did little to settle Talia and Batman’s tumultuous love-hate relationship. Regardless of her connection to Bruce or her father, Talia remains a powerful individual in her own right.
 Gameplay 
Trained since childhood, Talia has grown into an accomplished warrior. She is equally proficient in melee and ranged combat, which are boosted by her martial arts and marksman skills. 
As with all league members- handling explosives is an innate ability.
Versus power
Bodyguard: 
Talia Al Ghul, worthy daughter of Ra’s ramps up the firepower.
recruits 3 assassins with rifle and replaces the event tile by their tile.
At the beginning of the mission replace the event tile with an Assassins with rifle tile. This tile provides 3 Assassins with rifle minis instead of the normal 4.

Lady Shiva
There are many hired assassins in the world, but few as formidable as Sandra Wu-San. She is arguably the most accomplished martial artist in the world, even challenging the likes of Richard Dragon and Batman. She tends to work for the highest bidder as long as the contract doesn’t break her curious code of honor. She has even worked for Ra's Al Ghul and the League of Assassins. Her only weakness is that she seeks an opponent who can actually defeat her. At this point she has yet to find one, but perhaps someday her daughter, Cassandra Cain, will provide the challenge she so desperately craves. 
Gameplay
A Master assassin, this lady annihilates her opponents. And if a hero is foolish enough to throw down, odds are they won’t live to regret the decision.
Versus power
Fatality
Expert in assassination, she targets an opponent’s Leader or Lieutenant, hunts them down and strikes (Melee attack) with 2 orange dice and level 2 poison.

Heretic
When the League of Assassins created Damian Wayne, it was a complex and delicate process. In the end, Talia Al Ghul was not completely satisfied with her son’s loyalty or his capabilities. To improve on this design, she employed blasphemous arts and cloned him in the hope of creating a perfect warrior—one who would be fully grown, merciless, and, most importantly, obedient. What she ultimately got was a monstrous killing machine—another creation she deemed a failure. 
 Gameplay 
This fearless product of the Al Ghul’s experimentation with Damian’s DNA delivers devastating blows, this combined with his ability to take on multiple opponents make him the League member of choice to break through the other sides lines and take out its leader.
Versus power
Fury of the clone
Damian’s clone performs a melee attack using berserk skill level 2.

Assassins with rifle
 Gameplay 
Adept at ranged combat, these new troops are also explosives experts.
They can be substituted in the following corebox Adventure Mode Missions – 
“To Sink a City”, “Chain Mutation”, “An Icy Welcome”, “Suicide Escape” or “Sleep Well Children”.
Heads up – when a villain chooses to replace a tile in their river, he does so BEFORE the heroes form their team from the available choices.

Assassins
 Gameplay 
The triple skilled troop type, they are good in a fight, move quickly and avoid ranged attacks, but remain fragile in melee in comparison to other Elite troops.
They can be substituted in the following corebox Adventure Mode Missions – 
“To Sink a City”, “An Icy Welcome”, “Good Cops / Bad Cops” or “Sleep Well Children”.

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – The Sewers & GCPD Maps Expansion
Description:
This map-focused expansion for BATMAN™: GOTHAM CITY CHRONICLES offers a new double-sided game board representing two unique and iconic locations. Wage viscous battles amid the reeking waters of the Gotham City Sewers, and defend justice at the GCPD Police Headquarters. 
In the accompanying booklet you will find 10 new missions for Versus mode for use with these new maps as well as the expansion boards found in Season 1 (Arkham Asylum, The Joker’s Funhouse and Wayne Manor). 
Additionally, for when the Dark Knight needs a little extra power, this set includes a new double-tile for Batman’s Trasher Suit.

The Sewer
The sewers spawn a game board with a tight almost claustrophobic environment, obstructed lines of sight, a warren of walls and snug quarters full of villainy.
However, a section of the board is higher than the rest, which opens up lines of sight into many of these otherwise hidden zones, while providing the promontory bonus. But that aside, you are still going to have to sneak through the maze of abandoned quarters to look your opponent straight in the eye as you shoot.
These flophouses are excellent hiding spaces but achieving mission objectives will require you to hunt down evil in its’ lair, then melt away before the tide of approaching goons overwhelm you.
The board is separated into four large areas, the sluice clearly delineates 3 boundaries and the height difference between the zones adds another. Getting around the board requires a significant amount of movement, crossing the stinking sewers or jumping across takes a toll.
If you want to move about this board, better keep some cubes in reserve. Smooth area movement is a strategic requisite, hindering can shut your mobility down hard, so maintaining control of area boundaries is essential.
All this restriction is counterbalanced by highly mobile or parkour talented characters. They can easily navigate over the torrenting sluice and continue onwards, while highly mobile characters, like Killer Croc or King Shark can cross the board with ease as if the water wasn’t there allowing them access to an impressive amount of the board. 
These characters are a valuable asset on this board, as the open up the possibility of sneaking behind enemy lines or quickly providing reinforcement to overrun areas, in other words, it’s Blitzkrieg time.

Police Headquarters
With this brand new game board we are presenting another important and exciting location in Gotham City. This building serves as a bastion of law and order and a shield against chaos. From this location, brave men and women organize and mobilize to ensure the innocent are protected and the wicked are brought to justice. Under the dedicated watch of Commissioner Gordon and his trusted officers, the GCPD prevails time and again against the looming threats of the criminal underworld. 
 The Police Station allows you to play through new adventures, such as protecting (or destroying) compromising evidence or ensuring the safe release of significant prisoners.
 This board is organized into several sections, spanning several levels. On the ground floor, a long hallway allows characters to benefit from various lines of sight; but there are also intermittent columns which create advantageous cover. 
 Some areas, however, are more confined. These are ideal for the placement of objectives, such as cells, interrogation rooms, and the medical examiner’s facility. These areas are more difficult to access and well protected, so players will need to carefully consider the best routes to securing scenario objectives. 
 Each level offers different gameplay opportunities. On the first level, there are chief inspectors. This office, completely surrounded by walls, offers a necessary refuge for when the police station is under siege. The second floor overlooks a large corridor offering many tempting lines of sight. The archives sector, however, is a more enclosed space, offering only limited lines of sight. Those who can breach walls will, of course, have the option to cross over into adjacent rooms. Finally, the statue and columns of the police station allow particularly agile characters to quickly and easily access different levels and to avoid opponents—should that be of strategic benefit. 
 Because of its difficult terrain and the hidden paths created by columns, this board favors mobile characters. Centralized areas can be very dangerous due to the various lines of sight, and those attempting to cross should do so with caution.

10 Versus missions
 This new game boards pack comes with:

     A booklet with 10 new missions for the Versus mode expansion which allows to play new skirmishes on these two new game boards and on those of the expansions:


•2 missions on the police station game board.
•2 missions on the sewers game board.
•2 missions on the Wayne Manor game board (Wayne Manor expansion)
•2 missions on the Arkham Asylum game board (Arkham Asylum expansion)
•2 missions on the Joker’s Funhouse game board (Arkham Asylum expansion)

     8 new tokens that represent new types of objectives and allow to play with hidden objectives.
     Since many of you requested, one of these new missions for the Versus mode is to be played with double tiles. This is why you will find in this pack the double tile of Batman Trasher Suit (from the Wayne Manor expansion) as well as its life points marker.
    All the new Leader powers for all the new miniatures from season 2 (expansions, picking zone...). Those powers allow the new characters to be selected as Leaders when playing the Versus mode expansion.


—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – 5th Player Expansion
Description:
This expansion makes adding a 5th hero to your Bat-team worry free.

Now unleash 4 vs 1 in 3 Adventure mode missions and take Justice to that lawbreaker.
The “Detective Comics “ series by James Tynion IV is the setting for these 3 missions, Batman assembles a new Bat-team led by Batwoman and featuring the skills and talents of Stephanie Brown, Cassandra Cain, Tim Drake and Basil Karlo.
5th player Adventure mode provides the Evil Masterminds side with some much-needed fortitude to stand up to the might of 4 heroes of Gotham. Villains have access to a larger reinforcement point pool and a boosted Energy Cube turn recovery amount, that lays a good foundation towards going toe to toe with the team and instigating their heinous plan.
Careful consideration during setup is key to a villain’s victory, as the evil mastermind, you have to ensure that your back up is up to the job. Remember that point when creating your own missions in ”Mission Maker “. Back up, Back, up, back up – make sure you have some – tough cookies too.
Setting inspired, Clayfaces’ hero screen rounds out the expansion and the team, with Batwoman leading the plays – these 3 missions drop you right into the comics timeline.

Mission 1 – Our Heroes face off the Court of Owls, aided by Cassandra’s father as they plan to awaken an entire army of Talons to wreak chaos and destruction in Gotham City – it’s your job to foil them.

Mission 2 – The head of the Demon, attended by Deathstroke plans Gotham’s downfall. His plan ? take out the city’s economic backbone, destroy the corruption it creates. Your Job – Guard and Prevent.

Mission 3 - The St Dumas Order’s final creation is awakening – the team faces the Azrael assassins and the artificial intelligence Ascalon. It’s your job to lay waste to this order once and for all.

More Missions for this dedicated team will roll out, fully supporting 5 player mode into the future in addition to expanding the mission roster even further.

—description from the publisher

Name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Suicide Squad Expansion
Description:
In this new expansion, players will control members of Task Force X aka the Suicide Squad, as they navigate an exciting 3 mission Adventure Mode mini-campaign.

When a dirty job needs doing—one that requires unsavory methods and ethics that stretch the definition of legal—the government unshackles the Suicide Squad. Scruples shall not stay the hands of these former ex-cons, not if the ends justify the means.

An eternal threat of time travel and meta humans challenge the Squadron members during this campaign. But how they handle this threat it is up to you! Upon completing each mission, players may flash the included QR codes to uncover additional information regarding the ulterior motives lurking behind the antagonists of this campaign.

Because it’s somewhat uncomfortable and disingenuous to call Squad members “heroes”, in this expansion they will be identified as “Anti-Heroes”– a replacement term for heroes.


     10 new miniatures and 13 hero screens, including Season 1 characters such as Harley Quinn and Killer Croc. 
     11 tiles 
     15 equipment cards.


All Suicide Squad characters are Versus mode compatible and have individual powers.

You can expand your anti-hero mission pool further by adding the following core box components. This component mash-up maximizes the thematic campaign experience. 

     Katana, mini, hero screen and the katana equipment card.
     Killer Croc mini.
     Harley Quinn mini.
     1 service gun equipment card, allocated to Rick Flag
     1 service gun equipment card, allocated to Amanda Waller
     Poison Ivy mini. *
     2 Carnivorous Plant minis and their tile *
     1 Fire Axe equipment card allocated to The Joker's Daughter (Duela Dent)
     4 Guard minis to use in with the Belle-Reve's Guards tile included in this expansion.


* If you own Poison Ivy (new 52) and the Carnivorous Plants Rex, you can substitute them for the corebox Poison Ivy and Carnivorous Plants.

Build your own Suicide Squad: select from a 14-character pool (13 in this expansion, plus Katana) and prepare to get your hands dirty.

At the beginning of each mission, when choosing heroes, you can decide to rebuild a new team or continue with the one you assembled for the previous mission.

Your choices are made from three types of anti-heroes: Leaders, members of Squad S and those of Squad X.

Each anti-hero enters play fully loaded with a preset selection of equipment cards.

Last, but not least, the Belle-Reve Guards tile adds to the game wide available henchmen/elite pool from Versus mode or Adventure mode if a hero has the command skill.

These upgraded veterans are capable of performing complex actions but cannot share a mission with “Guards” tile – so make your choice between the two carefully before each mission. Their hindering skill is a painful thorn in your opponents’ side when they are after your leader or lieutenant.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gin-A-Word
Description:
Gin Rummy using letters to make words.  There are two decks of 52 cards with a letter and point value on each, plus a wild card.  One deck is used for 2-3 players, two decks for 4 or more.

Each player starts with a 10-card hand, and each turn consists of drawing a card and discarding a card. Once a player can use their 10 cards to make 2-3 words during their turn, they call "Gin-A-Word" and win the hand. Everyone then show their hand formed into words; the player who went out earns 25 points plus all the points in their hand, plus the value of the cards not used in words in all other players' hands. Multiple hands are played; a total of 150 points wins the game.

The plastic box the game comes in also includes a tray for the draw and discard piles.

—user summary

Name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Ghost Stone
Description:
Ghastly green spectres are flooding out of the Shadow Deep in the north, overrunning the Alladorean army and putting it to flight. Now, two groups of rangers must work together to launch a daring, and likely deadly, raid into the heart of enemy territory. But with an entire army between them and their target, can the rangers really hope to destroy the Ghost Stone?

Rangers of Shadow Deep: Ghost Stone is a four-scenario mission in which the player, or players, control two, different ranger groups on a desperate mission. The book also includes 52 unique, enchanted weapons that rangers can find during their explorations, several new monsters, and one unique auxiliary companion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine #4
Description:
Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine exists to bring new rules, scenarios, and gaming ideas for players of Frostgrave and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago.

This issue contains:

     7 new ‘Legendary Soldiers’ that wizards can hire for their warbands.
     A new solo scenario for Rangifer Warbands
     Rules for Critical Failures and Critical Success on Casting Rolls in Frostgrave
     A solo or co-operative scenario for Ghost Archipelago
     8 new Ulterior Motives cards for Ghost Archipelago
     A ‘Big-Game’ Frostgrave scenario featuring frost giants


—description from the publisher

Name: Injury or Illness
Description:
Injury or Illness is a delicious mix of misadventure, maladies and misfortunes. An infectiously entertaining game that will leave you in stitches that eventually become infected and require surgery. An absurd game of sick, dark humor that is toxically funny.

—description from the back of the box

Name: MACE: Martial Arts Card Engine
Description:
MACE is a game for 2 – 4 players. MACE simulates the fantastic martial arts battles common to fighting games and anime. Each player is represented by a Fighter, a master of the martial arts complete with vicious Strikes and powerful Blasts of energy. The goal is to Knock Out all other players Fighters, with the last one standing the winner.

MACE uses a deck of playing cards, a hex sheet and some tokens, so is easy to play and requires no book keeping. MACE also features a unique order mechanic called Momentum, which allows you to choose when you act.

If you are interested in anything anime or martial arts and like a fun simple system, then check out MACE!

Place one deck of playing cards in centre of play area. When a player plays a card from their hand, draw a card to replace it. All cards played are discarded to the discard pile next to the deck. If a player cannot draw a card because the deck is empty, shuffle discard pile and place as new deck.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bargain Quest: Golem Promo Hero
Description:
The Golem is an unusually adaptable hero who is unlike any other! Though it does not have any inherent class icons. The Golem's Customize ability allows you, the shopkeeper, to decide how best to prepare this hero for battle.

When the Golem enters your shop you can choose any one class icon, the golem can then equip any items of that class! Though its starting purse is average and its base stats are rather average, the Golem makes up for it with steady, steam-powered reliability! (Plus it's pretty dang cute.)

The Golem Pack also contain alternative art for the heroes of Black Market and An alternative art for the Evil Adventurers Boss.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Vignette of Death: White Gigalion
Description:
At the depths of despair, the survivors of Deadrock rush into the unknown wastes to discover a lurking in the dark.

Vignettes of Death are ready-to-play stories set in the world of Kingdom Death: Monster.  Vignettes of Death: White Gigalion tells the story of four unique survivors facing off with an aberrant form of a familiar foe. Use this Vignette in conjunction with your core game to battle the White Gigalion in a one-time showdown.

If the survivors of Deadrock are victorious, their story ripples through the world, unleashing the White Gigalion as a quarry monster for all Monster campaigns that include the White Lion monster.

In campaign play, the White Gigalion's menace inspires the settlement's ingenuity. The Catarium is expanded using the Giga Catarium, which includes new gear to build with resources gathered from the White Gigalion.

Vignettes of Death are ideal alternatives to campaign play, easy to jump into without unpacking your beloved settlements.

The Vignette of Death: White Gigalion box includes:

1 x White Gigalion with scenic base insert
1 x Hard plastic 100mm base
1 x 8 page Vignette of Death: White Gigalion small rulebook
4 x Unique vignette survivors (Gadrock, Hungry Basalt, Rock Knight, Breccia)
4 x Vignette survivor cards to create record sheets
4 x Vignette survivor gear grid overlays
2 x New White Gigalion AI cards
1 x White Gigalion Basic Action / Data card
1 x White Gigalion Hit Location
2 x Hooked Claw Strange Resources cards
1 x Strain Milestone card
5 x New Giga Catarium gear cards
1 x Lovelorn Rock gear card
1 x Giga Catarium settlement location extension

Name: Heaven & Ale: Kegs & More
Description:
Return to the 2018 Kennerspiel nominated Heaven & Ale with the Kegs and More expansion!

After years of honing the craft of beer making, the monastery has been commissioned to deliver the glorious ale to the local taverns. Such a challenge requires foresight and planning on your part. In addition to managing resources to brew beer, the monks are also tasked to collect barrels to store the ale and collect hay to ensure your delivery mule is well fed and strong. With the new gameplay elements, Heaven & Ale reminds fans of its modern classic status!

—description from the publisher

Name: hackd
Description:
“there are only two kinds of companies: those that have been hacked, and those that will be.” - kimmy johnny one

hackd is a playful way to build security awareness in any setting. if you consider yourself a security expert, take this opportunity to train your grandma, friends or clients.

a ceo and his team are trying to protect their organization from an active threat that is locking down critical machines for ransom.

they have to make several tough choices with limited resources - securing their machines, holding back the hackers, identifying malicious employees. they can't do it all. how can they avoid getting hackd?

—description from the designer

Name: Steel & Steed: A Wargaming Ruleset for Knights at Tournament
Description:
My Lords and Ladies, welcome to the world of Steel & Steed.

Within this book you will find the rules to help you create a knightly tournament worthy of a noble such as yourself. It is here that you will be given the tools to create one day competitions, large events testing the skill and merit of the bravest of knights or even run an ongoing campaign that will allow you to grow your house and become the envy of all the kingdoms across the land.  Sharpen your blade and ready your steed, honor and glory are yours for the taking!

Inside the rulebook you will find:


     112 pages of wargaming content for Knights at Tournament.
     Rules for Jousting, Mounted Combat, Foot Combat, Grand Melee and Archery.
     Rules for creating your own custom Knight.
     An armory containing different weapons, lances, bows and armor that can be used to outfit your knight exactly how you see fit for any given occasion.
     Four different breeds of horses with their own skills and abilities so your Knight can truly have his trusted steed when he rides off to tournament.
     A detailed campaign system that allows players to gain fame an fortune in the name of their House or even take to the road alone as a Freelance knight fighting for only coin and personal glory.


And so much more…

—description from the publisher

Name: Corri Pulcino
Description:
It is a game very similar to Uno for children. The card represents poults. Instead numbers and colors they have different postures, different disguises and make different faces. You can discard cards only if one of these characteristics match. There are also some special cards with special effects. First who remains without cards will win.

—user summary

Name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Characters Expansion
Description:
Includes - 
6 miniatures and player boards for new classes: Pyromancer, Cleric, Thief, Sorcerer, Mercenary, and Deprived.
10 armored character models to replace the basic player miniatures when the player discovers and equips the corresponding cards included in this box.

Name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Phantoms Expansion
Description:
Adds the ability to summon characters for assistance to aid in your fight and invaders to appear during encounters!

Contains 10 Summon and 11 Invaders miniatures and their corresponding cards.

Name: Tiny Epic Mechs: Kickstarter Deluxe Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack includes the Deluxe content offered for Tiny Epic Mechs during its Kickstarter plus a small expansion:

2 Pilot cards (front) / Power Suit cards (backs)

4 Loot Crate tokens (cardboard)

Spot Light Mini-Expansion with 4 Camera Bot tokens (wood)

Name: Eastern Empires: The Special Buildings Expansion
Description:
Eastern Empires: The Special Buildings Expansion is an expansion set that is compatible with Mega Empires: The East (2021) and Mega Civilization (2015). It provides additional flavor to the game through 9 miniatures of ancient buildings historically associated with each of the civilizations in the game. These buildings can be build on the map board and provide additional benefits in play and victory points to their controller.

—description from the designers

Name: Trivial Pursuit: The World of Wildlife –  Bite Size
Description:
Trivial Pursuit Bite Size: The World of Wildlife - 600 questions on animals, insects, reptiles and more! Comes in a case shaped like a Trivial Pursuit wedge. Use the card set in conjunction with an existing Trivial Pursuit board game, or play without by rolling the coloured die and reading a question of that colour.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gogo CHALLENGE: Round 01
Description:
GOGO Challenge is a Combination Puzzle Game that will help you to develop skills of: logical reasoning, concentration and perseverance (it has a lot of trial and error). People associate the game with a mix of Domino´s and Rubik´s cube.

The Goal of the game is to make a Gogo, that is, to complete the largest possible square by placing  the pieces in such a way that any pair of pieces with common sides share exactly the same figure (pattern and color). The pieces have two faces (reversible) and you can use them as you want.

You have two kind of Gogo´s: “The Simple Gogo” ( Easy) and “The Supreme Gogo”( Difficult).

You can have fun alone or with friends.
—description from the designer

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Sabine Wren Operative Expansion
Description:
Born into the proud warrior culture of Mandalore, Sabine Wren carries the history of her people within the very armor she wears into battle. Fueled by this history, she now lends her skills as both a warrior and an artist to the cause of the Rebellion.

Within the Sabine Wren Operative Expansion, you’ll find one finely detailed, easily assembled Sabine Wren miniature wading into battle as well as three command cards that help you unlock her full potential. Alongside these are a unit card fully outlining her abilities, four upgrade cards allowing you to further customize Sabine Wren to fit your battle plans, and all the tokens you need to fully integrate her into your Rebel army.

Contents:
1 Miniature
1 Unit Card
3 Command Cards
4 Upgrade Card
17 Assorted Tokens
1 Rulesheet

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Bossk Operative Expansion
Description:
Skillfully tracking his prey across the galaxy using his natural Trandoshan hunting instincts, Bossk has earned his reputation as one of the most feared bounty hunters in the galaxy. In the employ of the Empire, he'll go to any lengths to bring down the target that will net him the most money.

In the Bossk Operative Expansion, you’ll find an unpainted, customizable Bossk miniature armed to the teeth along with the unit card and upgrade cards that you need to fully outfit him for battle. Additionally, you’ll find Bossk’s three signature command cards, giving you access to even more weapons and tactics exactly when you need them.

Contents:
1 Miniature
1 Unit Card
3 Command Cards
3 Upgrade Card
20 Assorted Tokens
1 Rulesheet

Name: Tiny Epic Tactics: Deluxe Edition
Description:
This edition of the game, contains additional deluxe content unlocked during the Kickstarter that is packaged inside the box:
the Lanterns Mini Expansion  (4 Torch tokens, 7 Lantern tokens, 4 Tactic cards).

Tiny Epic Tactics utilizes a simple combat system with variable player powers and 3D terrain to achieve endless layers of strategy and fun.

Tiny Epic Tactics offers competitive play, cooperative play and solo play!

Conquer your opponents in tactical combat where every calculated move matters... or journey across the land and through the caves in a grand cooperative/solo adventure!

Nesting inside the game box are 5 smaller boxes and a map/scroll. Players will set up the game by placing these 5 boxes, plus the box bottom, onto the scroll in designated areas. This creates the environment that players will explore and battle across.

In Tiny Epic Tactics, players will have a team of 4 unique heroes: a Fighter, a Wizard, a Rogue and a Beast. Each hero type, and each character within that type, offers unique advantages to movement, attacks, and/or support. Finding the synergy in your team is key to victory.

In competitive play, players will pit their teams against one another in effort to score the most victory points by the end of the game. Each turn, players will have 3 actions to assign across their team. They can move and/or attack with their heroes. Victory points are rewarded for area control, enemy heroes captured, and keeping your own heroes alive. Gaining complete control of one, or multiple, specific areas offers the most victory points in competitive play. Gaining control of said areas requires your heroes maintaining majority presence in these areas over the course of a few turns. This requires a careful balance of offense and defense. The control of these areas can easily shift from one player to another based on which player has the majority heroes present in the designated spaces. Once a set number of areas are captured, or one of the players has lost all of their heroes, the end game is triggered.

Tiny Epic Tactics offers a distinctly different experience for solo and cooperative play. In these modes, players will adventure across the map, fighting spawning enemies and exploring caves (printed on the interior of each of the boxes). The goal is to acquire treasures, that belongs to the enemy, from these caves while keeping your heroes alive. Once the end of the game is triggered, victory points are tallied based on how many treasures you took from the enemy and how many of your heroes you kept alive.
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Bulk & Skull Character Pack
Description:
Behold the Purple and Orange Rangers!

Meet the two newest Power Rangers: Bulk and Skull!? That's right! Desperate times call for desperate measures!

With the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers captured, Zordon has called two very unlikely heroes into action. These two teenagers with even more attitude are Angel Grove’s only hope.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: Charge!: Rules for Starship Fleet Miniatures
Description:
Charge! is a tactical game designed for Space Fleet battles on a hexagon map.

The game is arranged round different ships sizes that have different power and speed. They have a common set of weapons, so it comes down to tactics who will win. There is a maximum of choices and a minimum of luck involved.
Players can design their own fleets using the points cost system.
The game is fast-paces and has minimum book keeping, so playing with large fleets is possible.
The designer has created 3D printable ships for the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Guinea Pig Bridge
Description:
A family fun strategy card game to race your guinea pigs to safety!

Build a bridge at least 5 cards long and move your guinea pig tokens across it. Slow down your competitors by distracting their guinea pigs.

Name: Glaves
Description:
OVERVIEW
Glaves is a trick-taking card game for 2-4 players.  A standard 52-card deck is used; aces are high, and twos are low.  It is a modified combination of two old card games named German Whist and Knaves (hence the name Glaves).  The object of the game is to get to a winning score before the other players do by playing several hands.  See total winning scores below based on the number of players.  The score for each hand is the number of tricks taken minus any penalty points for Jacks (Knaves) taken.  Several hands are played until one of the players gets the winning score (or more).  The player with the highest total score is the winner.  In the case of a tie, which is rare, the youngest tied player wins.

SETUP
Shuffle the deck.  For 2 players, deal 13 cards to each player.  For 3 or 4 players, deal 9 cards each.  Place the remaining cards face down as a draw pile and turn the top card face up.  If playing with three players, take the bottom card from the draw pile and put it aside, face up.  Its suit is the trump suit for the entire hand and is not otherwise used in the game.  With 3 players, taking the bottom card out makes the deck evenly split across the three players.  For 2 or 4 players, the face-up card on top of the draw pile at the start of the hand is the trump suit for the entire hand.  Subsequent face-up cards don't affect the trump suit in any way.

PLAY
The person to the left of the dealer plays a card from their hand face-up in the middle of the table.  They can choose any card from their hand of any suit.  (NOTE: The face-up card on the draw pile does not determine which suit is played, it's just the card that the winner of this trick will take into their hand.)  Each player must play the same suit led unless they don't have that suit, in which case, they may play a card of a different suit.  The highest card of the suit led takes the trick unless trump cards are played, then the highest trump card played takes the trick.  The person who takes the trick takes the face-up card on top of the draw pile into their hand.  The person to their left takes the next face-down card from the draw pile into their hand and so on until the last player has taken a card into their hand.  The last player to take from the draw pile then turns the next card face-up.  The person who took the trick goes first in the next trick.  Since each player draws a card from the draw pile each trick, the players will have the same number of cards in their hands until the draw pile is depleted.  Once the draw pile is depleted, play continues without drawing cards from the draw pile so that each player's hand decreases in size by one card per trick until all cards in their hands are gone.  That ends that hand and scores are totaled and recorded.

SCORING
Each trick you take counts as one point.  Each Jack you took in those tricks counts as -4 points for the Jack of hearts, -3 points for the Jack of diamonds, -2 points for the Jack of clubs, and -1 point for the Jack of spades.  It is possible to have a negative score if you take enough Jacks.




    
         Jack Suit 
         Penalty 

    
    
         Hearts 
         -4 points 

    
    
         Diamonds 
         -3 points 

    
    
         Clubs 
         -2 points 

    
    
         Spades 
         -1 point 

    


The total points across all players scored per hand for two players is 16, for 3 players is 7, and for 4 players is 3.  That's the total number of tricks minus 10 (the total Jack penalty).  You can make sure all scores each hand add up to those totals to make sure everyone counted correctly.  Play additional hands until one player reaches a total of 46 or more points for two players, 20 points for three players, or 9 points for 3 players.




    
         Players 
         Cards Dealt 
         Total tricks 
         Total points per hand 
         Winning score after multiple hands

    
    
         2 
         13 
         26 
         16 
         46

    
    
         3 
         9 
         17 
         7 
         20

    
    
         4 
         9 
         13 
         3 
         9

    


SHOOTING THE MOON
Any player may "shoot the moon" by taking all 4 jacks (instead of avoiding them).  This gives them the total number of available points for that hand (for example, 7 points for a three-player game), and everyone else gets zero points.  If you think someone is trying to shoot the moon, then you need to figure out how to eat the least painful jack before they end up with all the jacks.  Unless a player has the jack of the trump suit and perhaps one more jack, it can be difficult and risky to shoot the moon.  A player who is trying to shoot the moon might pretend to be disappointed at taking each jack, but not too disappointed, or the other players might catch on.

STRATEGY
Queens, Kings, and Aces are often dangerous cards since they take tricks with Jacks in them.  The strategy for this game is to pay attention to what has been played and what that implies about each player's hand, to be careful not to take Jacks by playing more conservatively the closer you get to the end of the game, and to purposefully run out of suits so you can drop a non-trump Jack on someone else's trick when the suit you don't have is lead.  Be sure to laugh and talk trash when you drop a Jack on someone who was happy to be taking a trick only moments before.

ORIGINS
My two coworkers and I invented and play-tested this game from 2-4 players for over a year to refine and balance it.  3 players is the optimal number, but 2 and 4 work fine as well.

GLOSSARY
Trick: One round of play where each player plays one card in the middle.  The highest-ranked card of the suit led (or the highest-ranked trump suit card, see below) takes the trick (the pile of cards played).

Trump Suit: This is the suit (hearts, diamonds, clubs, or spades) which is selected as being higher than the rest of the suits.  If a card of a trump suit is played on cards of non-trump suits, then the trump suit card takes the trick.

—description from the designer

Name: Last Alliance
Description:
In the Last Alliance game, each player represents an influential lord who claims power. Each player has a hand of similar cards that represent support among the most important factions of The Misty Land.

Each turn, the player chooses a card that represents the delegation they will send on the Glittering Mountains to discuss, ally (or beat!) with other delegations. Depending on the card played and the combination of cards which will be revealed, different effects will occur.

Diplomacy, bluffing, strategy, luck and the ability to convince other players to play certain cards will cause you to lose or be able to keep your cards. All players, play, all the time, at the same time. You will have to eliminate players, but without targeting anyone directly. The last two players with at least 3 cards are the Last Alliance and win the game

—description from the publisher

Name: Lunatic
Description:
The bluffing game that drives you mad

Lunatic is a card game that features a mix of deception, combinatoric choices and tactical thinking.

Don't let yourself be fooled by its simplicity: This is a tough game. You have to lie to your fellow players right in the face. You have have to catch them lying. You need to remember what cards left the game - even tough cards leave the game face down! You need a strategy. You need a second strategy if the tides change. You need to organise your hand so the others won't get a read on you. There's a million tricks to learn. You need to stay calm.

The game is for 3 to 4 maniacs, and one lunacy lasts about 5 - 10 minutes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Orléans: Gaming Room
Description:
Supplement of the Spielbox 4/2019

Alternative for Beneficial Deed

Name: Vintage Racers: Speedway Promo Pack
Description: The promo is a new track! - the Speedway - based off of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. It consists of 12 double sided cards.

Name: Reise ins Licht
Description:
Funny, exciting and meditative tasks are to be shared alone or with others.
The active player rolls the die and must move forward as many spaces as shown. Then he draws a task card. When he solved the task is , he can move forward as many spaces as indicated on the task card. If the task is not solved, the player rolls the dice again and must move backwards so many spaces spaces.
The first player to reach field 64 is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Das Gleis ist heiss
Description:
Drive as fast as possible from the specified start stop to the destination stop. Take a bus, tram, train or a ship of "Weiße Flotte". The goal is to arrive first, each of which can put obstacles in the way, e.g. event rings or construction workers.

—user summary

Name: Whitetail Wilderness: Woodland Pursuit
Description:
Whitetail Wilderness: Woodland Pursuit is a hand management game about hunting whitetail deer in the woodlands of Pennsylvania.

Game play is scenario-driven and takes place on a modular board. The player moves around the board and hunts deer by playing cards from their hand to take actions and deploy useful items. Once deer are spotted, cards are used to try and identify the deer while remaining hidden from their keen senses. If a suitable target is identified and the deer haven't detected the hunter and run away, the player can then take a shot. Dice are used to resolve checks for hunting, identifying, hiding, and shooting.

The scenario will specify the set up for the modular board as well as the goal of the game. The player's goal will typically involve bagging the largest buck possible before their deck runs out thereby ending the game.

This game is by the same designer as Whitetail Wilderness but is a wholly separate game sharing only the title.

—description from the designer

Name: Blanche Neige
Description:
A french card game in Snow White world, where players should associate dwarf cards by color or number.

The first player to discard all cards wins.

Name: Boucle d'Or
Description:
A French card game in goldilocks world where players should quickly identify similar symbols on cards.

Player who acquired most of the cards win the game

Name: Potocracy
Description:
Potocracy is an exciting new board game where you capitalize and monopolize the cannabis industry in each state.  Build your business, rake in the profits, take down the competition.

You collect the required cards and cash to setup a business in a state.  This may include cards for legalizing cannabis in the state if it is not legal yet.  Cards can also be collected to take over an opponent's business, to federally legalize cannabis, or to stop opponent actions.

Each state business progresses through:
  
  * not owned
  * Medical business
  * Recreational business
  * Greenhouse added

Businesses are subject to takeover until the business is monopolized with a Greenhouse.

—description from the designer

Name: Racing Kings
Description:
Racing Kings is a two-player abstract-strategy game which utilizes a chess board and all the chess pieces, except for the pawns. Moves are also the same as in chess, however, unlike chess, the goal of the game is to move a king all the way across the board.

Pieces are set-up as follows: White: King h2; Queen h1; Rook g1, g2; Knight e1, e2; Bishop f1, f2. Black: King a2; Queen a1; Rook b1, b2; Knight d1, d2; Bishop c1, c2.

Checks are not allowed. White moves first. Should Black reach the other side of the board one turn after White does, the game is drawn.

Racing Kings was popular in postal play, especially among members of NOST (the kNights Of the Square Table).

A shorter variant, called Dodo Chess, with the following set-up, has not gained the following Racing Kings has: White: King a1; Rook a2; Knight c1, c2; Bishop b1, b2. Black: King h1; Rook h2; Knight f1, f2; Bishop g1, g2.

—user summary

Name: Moonstone: Tumbledown Street Troupe Box
Description:
This troupe box includes 3 new heroes of Commonwealth fraction.
This miniatures are made in fine quality resin. Every miniature requires assembly.

Quack is a human wizard and cleric. He can heal the allies and blind or weak enemy units. 
Fritz is a human mercenary that could devastate enemy lines by his great sword and throw away some enemy units.
Agatha - human tavern lady that could support allied units and use concealed dagger against the enemies.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Advanced Virtus
Description:
A set of "Fast & Furious" ancient miniatures battle rules. Units continue doing whatever they're doing from turn to turn unless successfully ordered to do something else.

The game should be compatible with almost any basing scheme. Each figure represents 15 to 20 men, the ground scale is set by the players choosing a length of the "Distance Unit" that suits their figures and basing.

Name: Racing Stars
Description:
The Racing Stars are a superpowered team of magical girl go-kart racers. Queen Destructa has challenged them to a race, and summoned an army of monsters to help her team win.

Roll five different polyhedral dice, assign one to each racer, plotting a line that avoids collisions and sets up the others to get a speed boost by drafting. If they're going fast enough, they can run into monsters to defeat them. Each racer also has a special power you can use to gain an edge.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shuffle Cars
Description:
Race with your favorite characters from Disneys Cars, choose a team and be the first one to cross the finishline with all of your three cars to win the game.
There are two tracks each six spaces long, put two cars of your team on one track and the last one on the other track. Draw up to three cards and play up to two of them each round to move your cars along the track.

Name: Monster Faire Card Game
Description:
In Monster Faire Card Game, the players take on the roles of Mad Scientists. They live in crumbling old manors near the town of Beastly Vale, and compete in building Monsters from parts of dead bodies and bringing them to life. Requires two standard decks of playing cards, and recommended for three to six players. While not a true role-playing game as such, possession of role-playing skills will enhance the play experience.
- Publisher's blurb

Beastly Vale

The town of Beastly Vale lies in a forested valley. It is a simple rural woodland town that never has anything interesting or important happen to it – or so they say. For there are plenty of dark and scary stories told around town about the Mad Scientists who live in manors outside of town, and nobody likes to be caught outside after nightfall.

Mad Scientists

A number of Mad Scientists live near Beastly Vale, experimenting in their manors and not keeping healthy hours. Strange lights are seen at night, and paths leading from the manors to the local graveyard are kept in suspiciously good repair. Oh, whatever could they be up to?

The Monster Faire

Being in correspondence with each other, as members of the New Prometheus Society, the Mad Scientists have decided to hold a Monster Faire. They are going to compete in creating hideous new life! Whoever’s monster is the last one standing wins. If their monster is especially fearsome, they may even win the Promethean Scholarship.

—description from the designer

The rules for the game are distributed as a free, print-and-play file.

—user summary

Name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – House of M Promo Card
Description:
This promo card was originally available with the purchase of the Revelations Expansion at the Upper Deck Booth at Gen Con 2019 in an attempt to boost sales while at the convention.

Card text below:

Card Side 1:

Title of Card: House of M
