Setup: 8 Twists. Hero Deck is 4 X-men Heros and 2 non-X-men Heros. (Or substitute another team for all x-men icons on both sides.) Add 14 Scarlet Witch cards to the Villian Deck.

Special Rules: Each Scarlet Witch in the city is a Villian with Attack Power equal to its cost +3. If you fight one, gain it as a Hero.

Twist: KO all non-X-men Heros from the HQ. If there are at least 2 Scarlet Witch cards in the city, this Scheme Transforms. Otherwise, play another card from the Villian Deck.

Title (Transformed Side): "No More Mutants"

Transformed Special Rule (Transformed Side): Each Scarlet Witch in the city is a Villain with Attack Power equal to its cost +4. If you fight one, gain it as a Hero.

Twist (Transformed Side): KO all X-men Heros from the HQ. Play another card from the Villain Deck.

Evil Wins (Transformed Side): When the number of non-grey Heros in the KO pile is ten plus double the number of players.

Promo Code: LPC38
Printed in Canada

Name: Pecha Libre
Description:
Pecha Libre is a party game by the makers of Cat and Chocolate (Gentosha).  Players pit ridiculous characters against each other in battle using best persuasion skills to convince their friends that they have the superior fighter. It’s simple but can be a lot of fun with a good group of friends.

—descrpiption from the publisher

Name: Rats
Description:
Rats is a trick-taking game where each player is dealt a hand of 7 cards and an initial trump suit is determined by revealing the top card of the deck. The suit of this card is the trump suit for the first hand of cards.

The player left of the dealer leads the trick and everybody follows suit. The highest card takes the trick. If you cannot follow suit then you have the option to trump. A trump card beats everything other than another trump card. A card plaid which does not follow suit and is not a trump has no trick-taking capabilities. Trumps cannot be led until you have no cards left to lead other than trumps or until a trick has been taken by trumping another suit.

After the entire hand has been played, anybody that took 0 tricks is on "stand-by" for the rest of the game. The player that took the most tricks declares the next trump suit. Ties are broken by having each player draw from the remaining cards in the deck until one player draws a higher card than the other, and they decide the trump suit for the next hand.

A second hand of 6 cards is dealt, and then the player that decides trumps declares the trump suit. Play continues until all tricks have been taken. Any player which is on stand-by and took no tricks is eliminated from the game. Any player which was not previously on stand-by and took 0 tricks is now on stand-by. Whoever took the most tricks declares the next trump suit. Ties are broken as before.

Play continues with each hand decreasing down to 1 card or until all players have been eliminated. If two or more players remain after the hand of 1 card, play continues with hands of 1 card until only one player remains.

—user summary

Name: Escape Adventures: Von Basaren und Meisterdieben
Description: Family friendly puzzle book in an oriental setting.

Name: Escape Adventures: Von Mythen und Aztekengold
Description: Family friendly escape game in the world of the Aztecs. You have to solve puzzles and find clues. More geared towards a younger audience than other series.

Name: Monkey Klash
Description:
You are the leader of an army of monkeys and you have only one ambition: to be crowned Alpha player of the game!

Every turn, fruits and/or wasps fall from the trees and you must send one of your monkeys to pick them up. Hide one of your monkeys face down in the bushes and at the signal reveal it along with the other players.

The Primate hierarchy will organize the sharing. Be smart (like a monkey) to get a coveted fruit as soon as possible and klask quickly if another player monkey you with the same card.

If necessary, organize a baboon attack with an accomplice or betray him so that he chooses last. On the other hand, don't let your reflexes betray you: klash for no reason is very frowned upon in monkeys, and violent monkeys use the last ones and receive the pawns of shame.

Name: Dead Man's Cabal: Undeading Pack
Description:
Package of 10 ritual promo cards that were unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign and given for free at all backers.

The 10 cards are:
- Raptor
- Triceratops
- Philosopher
- Cantina
- Hamilton
- Childhood
- Dead Party Members
- Dunkleosteus
- Explorer
- Mittens

Name: Rise to Nobility: In the Pale Moonlight
Description: Character pack that adds 12 new characters to the base game.

Name: Rise of the Necromancers: Dawn & Demons
Description:
Dawn & Demons, the first expansion for Rise of the Necromancers, gives you the power to summon and command four highly detailed Demon miniatures. Now you will have two pieces on the game board, enabling your Necromancer to research the dark arts while your demon, the general of your undead army, conquers the lands in the name of its master.

Dawn & Demons also offers a CO-OP MODE where players work together to fight off the invading forces of light: the Arch Bishop and the impending dawn. In SOLO-MODE you will have to fight off the invasion all on your own. To win, all players must place their 13 Dominion Counters before the Arch Bishop calls forth the dawn and banishes all Necromancers and their minions. Cities will be reinforced by soldiers and mighty griffon knights will seek out libraries, workshops and dungeons to purge them of evil. Players will work together to share their evil plans and summon mighty demons that can crush the forces of light.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cyberpunk 2077: Afterlife – The Card Game
Description:
Cyberpunk 2077: Afterlife: The Card Game thrusts players into the dark alleyways of Night City where ruthless gangs clash with corporations in an endless war for money, power, and control.

In the game, you become fixers — databrokers and masterminds of Night City. Your job is to recruit cyberpunks, equip them with gear, and send them out on missions. Each successful mission raises your street cred, with mission survivors becoming veterans, imparting their knowledge and experience to newer recruits. In this chrome-infused world, street cred is the only currency that matters.

Nothing comes cheap in Night City. You need to balance between what you want and what you can actually afford. Using an innovative drafting mechanism and special dashboard, you must decide which cards you want to buy and which to sacrifice for funds in order to purchase new ones.

—description from the publisher

Name: On To Vienna!
Description:
On To Vienna! – simulating the Austro-Prussian War (1866) – is a sequel to On To Paris! using a wargame system adapted from Victory Games’ The Civil War. Players familiar with On To Paris! will be immediately familiar with the scale, system, rules and game play of On To Vienna!, taking the action to central Europe and Italy in 1866.

The systems challenge players to control the leadership, organization and military operations of Armies and Corps during the later 19th century, this time between Prussia and its ally Italy against Austria and the independent Federal German States, including Bavaria, Saxony and Hanover, with the exciting possibility of French Intervention.

Designed for two players, On To Vienna! is also suitable for solitaire play. Eleven scenarios include various ‘early start’ situations and the historical start of the war as well as a number of key points with the conflict already underway that can continue past the historical end of the conflict. An introductory “learning” scenario introduces players to the system and several scenarios look at exciting variations such as Austria being able to focus and bring more effort against either Prussia or Italy. Players can also pick any scenario as a starting point and determine their own period of the conflict to simulate. Most scenarios can be played on sections of the maps for smaller, shorter and faster games and as before with On to Paris! many optional rules explore interesting historical options for both sides.

On To Vienna! is a fast moving competitive game where players do their best to control their forces and where every decision creates excitement and tension. The game system features interactive game play with flexible initiative and variable turn length as well as extensive defensive player reaction ability. The game puts players in charge of all the famous Corps and Army leaders of the Austro-Prussian War which are all rated for their individual leadership qualities and occasional unique characteristics like resistance to following orders.

—description from the publisher

Name: Indian Wars: Custer
Description:
"Indian Wars: Custer" is a solitaire wargame in which you take command of the 7th Cavalry Regiment, under the famous general Georges Amstrong Custer and live again, in solo, three battles of the Indian wars.

In this game, three game boards represent the historic space of three major fights which delivers this hero of the western conquest to tribes Lakotas, Cheyenne and Arapaho: Washita (in November 27th, 1868), Honsinger Bluff (in August 4th, 1873) and Little Big Horn (in June 26th, 1876). On these maps, 1 cm represents approximately 200 meters and a game turn represent approximately half an hour of time.
The lenght of this game is 10 turns, it is the time which you have to manage the 7th of cavalry, the famous regiment of Custer, and allow him to fil his mission in spite of Indians warriors which will oppose you vehemently.

You can repel the American Indians who threaten your survival? You will try to replay history, but you can also explore new tracks by following the thread of the numerous proposed hypothetical scenarios. The task is difficult, but glorious. One thing's for sure, trust, it is a good day to win !!!

Name: D100 Dungeon: The Dragon Armour
Description:
The Dragon Armour Adventure Book introduces a different way of playing D100 Dungeon, and will give you choices much like a “choose your own adventure” game book. It uses all of the D100 Dungeon rules from the main rule book with a few modifications. Also included in the Adventure Book are some additional rules for D100 Dungeon that can be implemented into any of your D100 Dungeon games, whether you are playing a Quest, Campaign or an Adventure.

You will need the D100 Dungeon rule book to play this Adventure book and it is compatible with the D100 Dungeon Mapping Game.

Available from - https://www.drivethrurpg.com/browse/pub/13157/Martin-Knight?src=browse13157

Name: Dead Throne: World of Veles
Description:
Dead Throne 2nd Edition

1-7 players with 2 competitive, 2 solo and a Co-Op mode already included, as well as the ability to build your own scenarios. Multiple ways of winning as well as the ability to simply roam around killing creatures, completing side quests and interacting with the game in the open world setting.

Dead Throne is a game that is never the same. It combines an ever changing world of challenges, magic, creatures, enemies, quests, items and more. With 10 large double-sided tiles, multiple paths to victory, loads of options and decisions with every turn, the ability to build your own scenarios and an in-depth world to discover, you'll never say it's predictable.

There are 150 scrolls in the game. The Box itself has been designed with fluidity in mind. The box contains three inserts to manage the various components. The Market and tokens are contained in their own insert that can be passed around the table.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box
Description:
Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box contains five expansions for previous DSP winners.

The promos are for:

IceCool - (Kinderspiel 2017) https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/292884/icecool-walrus-expansion
Imhotep - (2016 - number 8) https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/292887/imhotep-sun-ship-tiles
Just One - (2019 - number 9) https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/292745/just-one-deutscher-spielepreis-classic-goodie-box
Leo (muss zum Friseur) - (Kinderspiel 2016) https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/292911/leo-snake
Puerto Rico - (2002 - number 1) https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/292912/puerto-rico-buccaneer

Bonus:
Imhotep Duel: https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgameexpansion/292888/imhotep-the-duel-tomb-c-and-d

Name: SPAXX! & friends
Description:
All cards are distributed. Now it's about getting rid of the cards as fast as possible. 
The first player decides what he lays out (a combination of cards of equal value). The others must place the same combination of a higher value. You can only place cards if you have a higher combination than the predecessor. Raise or fold. The first player that plays his last card becomes the "Super Spaxx". The last player that still has cards becomes the "Spaxx". Then players have to change seats to sit in descending score order from "Super Spaxx" to "Spaxx"
From the second round, cards are exchanged according to the placement. "Spaxx" has to give his 3 highest cards to "Super Spaxx" and gets 3 other cards in return.

The game follows the mechanisms of Animal Poker/Career Poker. 
But this game has less cards (100 vs 115) and is for less players.
Both games are based on the cardgame ZhÄ“ng Shàngyóu.

Spaxx sounds as Spass, the German word for Fun.

Name: The Calling: A Cthulean Social Deduction Game
Description:
The Calling is a Social Deduction game where players are Investigators in the FBI, following up with reports of insanity and murders by the local docks. Soon after, the same symptoms begin to rise within the Precinct causing the Investigators to suspect the work of a Cultist of the whispered Cthulhu, acting as an Investigator by day, and doing the Profane work of the Deep one by night.
The Calling plays similarly to most Social Deduction games with a day phase and a night phase, but the distinctive difference is that it is moderatorless, and part of completing a night action, players wake up the next person. The Calling also uses a "Murder Party" mechanic, where during the day any three players can band together to instantly kill a player, Dead players can also instigate or contribute to murder parties, allowing them a lot of power as the balance of alive and dead players tips towards final day. Finally All dead players become evil once dead, as the Cultist assembles an ever growing army of the dead, to help defeat the astute investigators.

—description from the publisher

Name: Scripta
Description:
Immerse yourself in the era of scribes and engraved stones. Write words together, collect laurel wreaths and get rid of your cards as soon as possible. Only one will win...It's up to you to make history.
The goal of the game is to find a letter to ask to continue the word in progress.
The first player must think of a word that begins with the letter drawn and put the second letter of that word down by choosing from the cards in his hand. The next player must think of a word starting with the two letters on the table and put the third letter on the table, and so on.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mistborn: House War – Rabble Rouser Promo Card
Description:
First available at Gen Con 2019. The card states:

"Lasting. Play face up on your turn in front of another player. Stays in play.

At the beginning of each of this player's turns, they gain 1 Disgrace."

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Feudal Village Expansion
Description:
The new item that has generated the most excitement from backers so far is the Feudal Village Expansion! Much like the Frontier Town Expansion for the original Shadows of Brimstone Old West setting, the Japanese Feudal Village Expansion greatly enhances the Town experience for Forbidden Fortress!

This Expansion adds 6 new Town Locations to visit, including the Western Trading Post, Tea House, Brotherhood Temple, Sacred Garden, Gambling Parlor, and the ability to take an audience with the local Samurai Lord.

It also includes 8 new Specialty Village Types (such as the Corrupted Village, Nobu Slave Village, or Trading Port), a new deck of Feudal Village Town Event cards, 3 different sizes of Town Map and the Location Tokens for dynamically generating a different Village each time you visit, a large-size folding tactical Village Game Board for playing Missions in Town, as well as 6 new Village Missions, and a new Feudal Bandits Enemy Type to raid the Villages including the Enemy Record Sheet, Threat Cards, and 12 miniatures for these new Enemies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Oni Warlord XXL Enemy
Description:
Feared throughout the land, the great giant, Akuma Oki, is a brutal Oni Warlord. Carrying a massive, wooden cage on his shoulder, he raids villages and farms to collect slaves, for food and to work in his Dark Stone mines! Worshiped as a god by the Nobuhara Clan, they drive his massive slave armies to fight and die for the black rock! This XXL Deluxe Enemy Pack is themed for the Forbidden Fortress World and includes the massive Oni Warlord miniature, Enemy Record Sheet, 2 new Missions, and a host of new cards to add to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Odo Kuro XXL Enemy
Description:
Formed from the amassed bones of the unburied dead that litter the battlefields across the land, the Odokuro is a massive skeletal creature that erupts from beneath the blood-soaked soil to attack unwary travelers, feasting on their flesh to feed its unquenchable hunger! Bursting out of the ground, it lashes out with its gigantic arms to claw and smash the Heroes, biting off the heads of its most unlucky victims and feeding on the spray of blood that erupts from their necks. The Odokuro is a terrifying beast to behold and the Heroes will need all of their courage to battle their way close enough to the creature to get past its bony defenses. This monstrous XXL Enemy Pack is themed for the Forest of the Dead OtherWorld (as well as the Forbidden Fortress World) and includes the giant-sized Odokuro miniature, Enemy Record Sheet, 1 Mission, and all of the cards needed to add this frightening fiend to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spyfall: The Roman Senate promo cards
Description: This promo pack adds ten Roman Senate location cards and two Spy cards.
